intro: Ectasis banksia, commonly known as the yellow banksia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive cylindrical inflorescence. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that attract nectar-feeding birds and insects. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, adapted to withstand the dry conditions of its habitat. Ectasis banksia is often found in heathlands and dry forests, where it plays an important role in local ecosystems.
